title: How to Contribute Drawings to Lake: Coloring Books App on iPhone or iPad

steps.headline: Open the Mail app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.description: The Mail icon looks like a white envelope on a blue background. You can find it on your home screen, or in an app folder. Feel free to use a different email service or app. Most email apps work in a similar way.

steps.headline:
Tap the blue {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/ff\/Iphonequick_compose.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/ff\/Iphonequick_compose.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of an Apple icon\n<\/p>

License: Fair Use<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} icon on the bottom-right corner.
steps.description: It will open a new, blank email message.

steps.headline: Enter info@lakecoloring.com as your email's recipient.
steps.description: Tap the "To" field at the top of the email, and enter this email address here. Lake doesn't have a specific email address for artist applications. They receive applications in their info mailbox.

steps.headline: Enter a relevant subject line about your artist application.
steps.description: Tap the "Subject" field below "To," and enter a brief and clear subject line that lets the reader know you want to get your drawings featured.

steps.headline: Explain why you want to get featured in the email body.
steps.description: Make sure to write about your prior experience and skills to demonstrate how you can make a significant contribution to the Lake community as an artist.

steps.headline: Include your Instagram link or handle in your email message.
steps.description: Lake considers your Instagram profile a good way to get a grasp of your talent, skills, and community interactions to assess if you're a good fit. Make sure to post some of your best and most recent work on your Instagram profile. This is the best way to showcase your skill level and style in your application.

steps.headline: Tap the Send button on the top-right.
steps.description: This will send your email message to Lake's info mailbox. You'll receive a response from the Lake team to talk further about getting your work featured as an artist.

text:
Open the Mail app on your iPhone or iPad. The Mail icon looks like a white envelope on a blue background. You can find it on your home screen, or in an app folder. Feel free to use a different email service or app. Most email apps work in a similar way. Tap the blue {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/ff\/Iphonequick_compose.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/ff\/Iphonequick_compose.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of an Apple icon\n<\/p>

License: Fair Use<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} icon on the bottom-right corner. It will open a new, blank email message. Enter info@lakecoloring.com as your email's recipient. Tap the "To" field at the top of the email, and enter this email address here. Lake doesn't have a specific email address for artist applications. They receive applications in their info mailbox. Enter a relevant subject line about your artist application. Tap the "Subject" field below "To," and enter a brief and clear subject line that lets the reader know you want to get your drawings featured. Explain why you want to get featured in the email body. Make sure to write about your prior experience and skills to demonstrate how you can make a significant contribution to the Lake community as an artist. Include your Instagram link or handle in your email message. Lake considers your Instagram profile a good way to get a grasp of your talent, skills, and community interactions to assess if you're a good fit. Make sure to post some of your best and most recent work on your Instagram profile. This is the best way to showcase your skill level and style in your application. Tap the Send button on the top-right. This will send your email message to Lake's info mailbox. You'll receive a response from the Lake team to talk further about getting your work featured as an artist.
